title: -Anything is Possible-

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
(((((((     http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/94272157/200801479?tab=overview       ))))))

Just a bit of solo/duo queue Inspiration for everyone. Entered a game expected the biggest lost with my Vladimir friend, with an ad Ahri bot, A trolling Darius and a blitz. We decided to fight it out to the end, never giving up, and romped the competition after 33 minutes. I myself could never climb, was always blaming teammates and hated solo/duo queue. After this game and the ones that followed, I've turned my attitude around, observing and playing the game differently, which has inevitably lead to a 9 win streak. I think what I'm trying to say here is, never give up, find that champion that suits your play-style and, never flame at other people for doing bad. Its unhealthy and will NOT win you games. 

From,

A Ranked Player with a Dream

{{champion:32}}{{champion:8}}{{champion:32}}{{champion:8}}{{champion:32}}{{champion:8}}{{champion:32}}{{champion:8}}{{champion:32}}
